Header: Children survive after car rams into them at Peru intersection
Content: Five children survived a horror crash in Lima, Peru after a car lost control during a u-turn and rammed into minors on the footpath. Officials reported that four girls were hit by the driver outside their school. One of the victims is a three-year-old boy who was with his mother. Local media reported the driver had made the u-turn at an intersection in the suburb of Miraflores when she lost control and mounted the footpath. The children were rushed to hospital for treatment but are expected to make a recovery. The driver has been taken into police custody.
